New Records: De'Aaron Fox set a season-high with 49 points, and he now has the most points over a two-game span in franchise history, surpassing DeMarcus Cousins.
Key Match Events: The Jazz opened the third quarter with a 10-3 run and bumped their margin up to 89-78 on a layup by Isaiah Collier.
Sacramento came back in the fourth to take a 118-116 lead on a Jordan McLaughlin 3 with a minute left to play.

Fox made one free and missed the next two with 13 seconds left to play, Clarkson made one free throw before the Jazz were called for a lane violation, and Fox made the last two free throws to seal the victory.
Pre-Game Insights: DeMar DeRozan, Malik Monk and Domantas Sabonis were sidelined for Sacramento, and Taylor Hendricks and Walker Kessler did not play for the Jazz.
Post-Match Reflections: Fox now has the most points over a two-game span in franchise history, surpassing DeMarcus Cousins.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings led 62-50 late in the second quarter and held on for a 64-63 margin at the half.
Lauri Markkanen had 25 points, Collin Sexton added 18, and Keyonte George scored 19 points for the Jazz.
